abstract: NBC Universal’s new chief executive overcame falling prime-time ratings starting three years ago while he led the company’s television group.
snippet: NBC Universal’s new chief executive overcame falling prime-time ratings starting three years ago while he led the company’s television group.
lead_paragraph: In announcing the appointment yesterday of Jeff Zucker as the president and chief executive of NBC Universal, his boss at General Electric said that what could have been Mr. Zucker’s biggest vulnerability — NBC’s plunge in prime-time ratings starting three years ago while he led the company’s television group — had actually worked to his advantage.

headline.main: Zucker’s Bumpy Ride to the Top
headline.print_headline: Zucker’s Bumpy Ride to the Top

byline.original: By Bill Carter and Jacques Steinberg

abstract: As India and the United States gradually relax policies on military collaboration between the two countries, American companies hope to compete for contracts worth billions of dollars.
snippet: As India and the United States gradually relax policies on military collaboration between the two countries, American companies hope to compete for contracts worth billions of dollars.
lead_paragraph: BANGALORE, India, Feb. 6 — Encouraged by the passage late last year of the first agreement on nuclear cooperation between India and the United States, American military contractors and technology companies have flocked to the technology hub of Bangalore this week in the hope of winning some of the biggest military contracts.

headline.main: U.S. Military Contractors Seek Deals at Bangalore Air Show
headline.print_headline: Sensing Opportunity at Indian Air Show

abstract: As India and the United States gradually relax policies on military collaboration between the two countries, American companies hope to compete for contracts worth billions of dollars.
snippet: As India and the United States gradually relax policies on military collaboration between the two countries, American companies hope to compete for contracts worth billions of dollars.
lead_paragraph: BANGALORE, India, Feb. 6 — Encouraged by the passage late last year of the first agreement on nuclear cooperation between India and the United States, American military contractors and technology companies have descended on Bangalore, the country’s technology hub, this week in the hope of winning some of the biggest military contracts.

headline.main: U.S. Military Contractors Seek Deals at Bangalore Air Show

abstract: The company’s acquisitions in growth platforms mean more technologies to tap into for use in its other businesses.
snippet: The company’s acquisitions in growth platforms mean more technologies to tap into for use in its other businesses.
lead_paragraph: NISKAYUNA, N.Y. — Christoph Hergersberg stands before a wall-size diagram with far too many arrows, symbols and letters for an untutored eye to decipher.

headline.main: G.E. Finds Strength in Its Diversity
headline.print_headline: G.E. Finds Strength In Its Diversity

abstract: Biotechnology, security, energy services and “green” products are just some of the areas that Jeffrey R. Immelt, General Electric‘s chief since 2001, has singled out as the company’s growth platforms. He has jettisoned reinsurance and advanced materials, two slow-growth businesses, and the plastics business is on its way out.
lead_paragraph: Biotechnology, security, energy services and “green” products are just some of the areas that Jeffrey R. Immelt, General Electric‘s chief since 2001, has singled out as the company’s growth platforms. He has jettisoned reinsurance and advanced materials, two slow-growth businesses, and the plastics business is on its way out.

headline.main: G.E. Finds Strength in Its Diversity

abstract: Is General Electric considering a sale of NBC Universal? Amid all the hubub surrounding the appointment of Jeff Zucker as the president and chief executive of NBC Universal, a report surfaced suggesting that the increased involvement of G.E.’s chairman, Jeff Immelt, in the direction of its entertainment filial could be a sign that it is mulling an eventual exit from the TV and film business.
lead_paragraph: Is General Electric considering a sale of NBC Universal? Amid all the hubub surrounding the appointment of Jeff Zucker as the president and chief executive of NBC Universal, a report surfaced suggesting that the increased involvement of G.E.’s chairman, Jeff Immelt, in the direction of its entertainment filial could be a sign that it is mulling an eventual exit from the TV and film business.

headline.main: Zucker’s Bumpy Ride to the Top
